__e: So I take it things aren't going so well with you and Ash.
The new Ash still hasn't restored order.
No thanks, Ash, not feeling too clever, to be honest.
I know how frightening this must have been for you, Mother, and I appreciate you coming back to Ash Park for me.
I heard you're going to Ash Park tomorrow in place of your father.
Um, uh, thank you, both of you, for agreeing to come and live at Ash Park for a little while.
"Ooh, ooh, ooh, hi, I'm Kelly! "I do whatever Ash "wants me to do, too."
Ash told me about your problem, and I think I found you a date for your party.
Ash asked me when I thought it might end, as if there was some obvious end point, but...
Really, because I haven't had a good feeling since we met Ash, and his stupid book.
I don't know, I mean, if I've learned anything from you, Ash, it's that if something seems too good to be true, it probably is, and also she doesn't smell that nice.
There's only one way to put an end to all this Ash, and you know it.
